title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When creating a "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer, in the "defaultValue" field, if an invalid date string is entered, such as "55/66/9999", the invalid value is accepted. The following definition appears in the report design:

<parameters>
    <scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
        <property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
        <property name="allowBlank">false</property>
        <property name="format">Unformatted</property>
        <property name="controlType">textbox</property>
        <expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
    </scalarparameter>
</parameters>

There are two problems with this behavior:

(1) The model should have stored a date/time type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
EB: The report designer should reject an invalid date/time string and display an error message to the user.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, perform the following steps:

1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a new report parameter of type "DateTime".
4. In the "defaultValue" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
5. Save the report design.
6. Open the report design and observe the parameter definition in the XML.
